acts.name: IP spoofing
acts.desc: Send packages with the faked IP address. Counter those techniques based on IP addresses.

acts.name: Promiscuous mode
acts.desc: The knowledge of setting up Network Interface Card (NIC) in promiscuous mode. Enables you to capture all packages in your local area network.

acts.name: Sniffing attack
acts.desc: Obtain rival's username and password, as well as other data, provided that the communication is not encrypted or hashed.

acts.name: MITM
acts.desc: Performe a Man-In-The-Midele attack. If no authentication of any kind, give the buff "MITM".

acts.name: Deauth attack
acts.desc: Deauthenticate in place of the victim in the Wifi network. This Kicks the victim's personal computer offline, so that the victim cannot perform acts in his round. Offline is also a buff required for "Rogue access point".

acts.name: Zero-day attack
acts.desc: Make a use of a most newly found vulnerability. Strike quickly, so that no one is able to counteract in any way. This attack costs grealy, but overwhelming.

acts.name: DoS
acts.desc: Denial of Service attack. Send endless requests to serverer to paralyze it. Rival will have problem serving requests, and therefore, gains much less resouces. Consumes much resources on the attacker side.

acts.name: DDoS
acts.desc: Distributed Denial of Service attack. Make use of a big crowd of computers to synchronously attack the victim server. With large amount of botnet machines, its sucess rate is much more than the original DOS attack. Effect based on how many botnet machines bought.

acts.name: Buy botnet machines
acts.desc: buy 2 botnet machines to increase the strength of the DDoS attack

acts.name: Shadow server
acts.desc: A fake server replicating the appearance and feel of another server. Usually created to lure the unaware clients to enter sensitive data.

acts.name: Phishing
acts.desc: One of social engineering method. Ignore all defensive techniques.

acts.name: Spear phishing
acts.desc: One of social engineering method. Ignore all defensive techniques. Different from ordinary fishing, it exploits more knowledge of the victim, which greatly increses success rate

acts.name: Whaling
acts.desc: One of social engineering method. Ignore all defensive techniques. Different from ordinary fishing, it targets high-value victim, which yeilds more when the attack success

acts.name: Hash algorithm
acts.desc: The knowledge of what a cryptographic hash function is. Prerequist for hash-related techniques.

acts.name: Symmetric cryptography
acts.desc: The knowledge of symmetric cryptography. Prerequist for nearly all the encryption techniques.

acts.name: Asymmetric cryptography
acts.desc: The knowledge of Asymmetric cryptography. Prerequist for PKI and RSA key exchange.

acts.name: PKI
acts.desc: Build the public key infrastructure. The buff is necessary for MQV and RSA key exchange.

acts.name: CDN
acts.desc: Create Content Delivering Network. The server becomes more resistant to the burst of requests and to DoS attack as well.

buffs.name: 503 Server Unavailable
buffs.desc: Our server is overleaded with requests. Are we under DoS attack? Or it's just because of the boom of our business?

buffs.name: Offline
buffs.desc: The character is offline. Is it somebody's trick?

buffs.name: Credential compromised
buffs.desc: the character's password is compromised by the rival.

buffs.name: Denial of service attacked
buffs.desc: The target server is under denial of service attack. The server is much more loaded, and it may fail to serve the legitimated users.

buffs.name: Shared channel
buffs.desc: The characters have a shared channel. All unencrypted data can be easily sniffed.

buffs.name: Wifi channel
buffs.desc: Both characters are connected to the same Wifi. Cautious for Wifi-based attack like Rogue access point.

buffs.name: MITM
buffs.desc: the rival has performed MITM(Man In The Middle) attack. Unencripted data could be sniffed by the rival; Unauthenticated data could be modified by the rival. Reply attack is also possible.

buffs.name: Encrypted
buffs.desc: the data transfered over the Internet is encrypted. Sniffing attack alone will not compromise secrecy.

buffs.name: PKI
buffs.desc: The public key infrastructure is built. certificate-based techniques like MQV and RSA key exchange are possible.

buffs.name: IP spoofing
buffs.desc: The packages are sent with spoofed ip. Who knows what a real IP the sender has.

buffs.name: MFA
buffs.desc: this character has activated multiple factors of authentication. The success rate of the opponent's attack is reduced

buffs.name: CDN
buffs.desc: Content Delivering Network is created. The server becomes more resistant to the burst of requests and to DoS attack as well.

buffs.name: Shadow server
buffs.desc: This character has created a shadow server in place of a real one. He can use social engineering techniques or DNS spoofing to trick the rival to visit this server, which results in credential compromised
